intro: Pycreus lanceus, commonly known as the lanceleaf pycreus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
